bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Emily Hernandez Calamari (1903-1994) came from a family of Brooklynites who were very active in their local communities. Her grandfather headed the U.S. Army Band at Fort Hamilton in Brooklyn, and her father headed the U.S. Army Band at both Fort Hamilton and Washington, D.C. During World War II, Ms. Calamari was Head of Personnel at the Medical Depot in Brooklyn, which was headed by her future husband, Joseph Augustine (J.A.) Calamari.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of material belonging to Emily Hernandez Calamari, many of which pertain to the Brooklyn neighborhood of Bay Ridge but also to Brooklyn in general. Materials include correspondence and family documents, portraits and photographs of the Hernandez family and the Bay Ridge neighborhood, correspondence and legal documents regarding burial plots in Green-Wood Cemetery and Long Island National Cemetery, documents relating to J.A. Calamari's military service, baptism certificates, membership certificates, and ephemera such as menus and newsletters. Also included are bound volumes containing J.A. Calamari's undergraduate and graduate theses, a Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn yearbook, and histories of Bay Ridge covering the 16th through 20th centuries.
